---
name: backend-api
description: Build REST APIs with Django REST Framework following project standards for ViewSets, serializers, permissions, and response formats. Use this skill when creating or modifying API endpoints, writing ViewSets or APIViews, defining serializers for models, implementing custom permissions or authentication, adding filtering/pagination/ordering to endpoints, working on files in api/ or views.py, or editing files like serializers.py, permissions.py, throttling.py, and urls.py for API routes.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When creating new REST API endpoints or ViewSets
- When writing or modifying Django REST Framework serializers
- When implementing API permissions or authentication logic
- When adding filtering, pagination, or ordering to API responses
- When defining custom API actions with @action decorator
- When working on files named views.py, serializers.py, permissions.py, or urls.py in API contexts
- When configuring throttling or rate limiting for endpoints
- When designing URL patterns for REST resources
- When implementing nested serializers or custom validation in serializers
- When working with DRF's APITestCase for endpoint testing

# Backend API

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle backend API.

## Instructions

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
